definition: Forms of electronic communication such as websites, videos, and animations used to convey information or entertainment

The sequence of processes through which a digital media project passes from initiation to completion
A document outlining the goals, scope, and deliverables of a digital media project
A legal right that protects original works of authorship from unauthorized use
A legal doctrine allowing limited use of copyrighted material without permission under specific conditions
Creative works that are not protected by copyright and can be used freely
The unauthorized use or reproduction of copyrighted material
A licensing system that allows creators to share their work with specific usage permissions
Moral principles guiding the responsible use of digital media
Fundamental guidelines like balance, contrast, and alignment that enhance visual composition
The distribution of visual weight in a design to create stability
The use of differing elements like color or size to create visual interest
The focal point in a design that draws the viewer’s attention
The placement of elements in a design to create order and cohesion
The reuse of design elements to create consistency and unity
Grouping related elements together to organize information in a design
The study of how colors interact and their impact on design
The art and technique of arranging text to make it readable and visually appealing
A typeface with small lines or extensions at the end of strokes
A typeface without small lines at the end of strokes
The empty areas in a design that improve readability and balance
Images composed of pixels, suitable for detailed photographs
Images created using mathematical paths, scalable without quality loss
The number of pixels in an image, affecting clarity and file size
Guidelines to ensure safe use of equipment and software in digital media production
The design of workspaces to maximize comfort and efficiency
Non-technical skills like communication and teamwork essential for professional success
Conducting oneself with responsibility, integrity, and respect in a work environment
The ability to plan and control how time is spent to complete tasks efficiently

The amount of data processed per second in digital audio or video, affecting quality

The number of frames displayed per second in a video, affecting smoothness
A frame in animation or video that defines the starting or ending point of a transition
Animated graphic elements used to enhance visual storytelling
The process of creating a three-dimensional digital representation of an object
The process of generating a final image or video from a digital model or scene
Combining multiple visual elements into a single image or video

The process of creating moving images through a sequence of static visuals
A visual plan of shots or scenes to guide the production process

A tangible outcome or product submitted as part of a project
A significant point or event in the timeline of a project
